intro: Genista raetam, commonly known as the Alpine broom, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and yellow, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its growth habit is shrub-like, with multiple branches and dense foliage. Genista raetam is adapted to harsh climates, exhibiting resilience to cold and poor soil conditions.
